Versatile Custom Field Types and More!
Welcome to our latest DevStride release, where we're elevating project management with various powerful new features, especially our versatile custom field types!
We've added a robust selection of custom field types to supercharge your data organization. These include:
Email, Phone Number, and URL Fields
Number, Percentage, Checkbox, and Switch Inputs
All new fields are fully filterable
, allowing you to tailor your data views precisely to your needs.
Hover over the blocked tag to see a tooltip with the blocker description for immediate insights into what's stalling your tasks.
We've improved the recent items list by combining workstreams and items into one streamlined, flat list.
New edit and delete buttons in the cycle column view make managing your cycles easier than ever.
The sort dropdown has been enhanced with increased height, revealing more options at a glance for easier selection.
Gantt chart loading is now more efficient with asynchronous requests, ensuring a swift page load without delays.
A new summary row at the bottom of the board and cycle column views give you a snapshot of aggregated stats.
The summary row now reflects filtered assignees, showing their items and subitem totals.
Bulk Edit for Sibling Item Types:
Users can now perform bulk edits on item types if the items are of sibling types, streamlining mass updates.
You can now share automation workflow forms via a link, facilitating easier collaboration.
We've tuned the filter on the Gantt view to include child items, ensuring complete and accurate displays of your project timelines.
Fixed the progress bars for parent items with a manual percent completed, ensuring they display the correct progress.
Corrected the styles for the time input field in dark mode for better visibility and consistency.
Resolved issues with item sorting on the board view to maintain the order you expect.
Eliminated the phantom spacing bug that occurred when adding names to item types, ensuring a tidy and error-free display.

We're proud to deliver these updates to enhance your project management experience. As always, we're grateful for your feedback and look forward to hearing how these new features help drive your projects forward. If you need assistance or want to share your thoughts, our support team is just a message away!
User-Defined Item Types, Enhanced Completion Stats, UI/UX Overhauls, and More!
In our latest DevStride update, we're excited to bring you significant enhancements that offer more customization, clearer insights, and a smoother user experience. Let's dive into the new changes:
User-Defined Item Types and Child Items:

A major system improvement! Define your own item types for work items and create hierarchies with child items in the settings. This offers unparalleled flexibility in how you organize and manage work. Tags, custom fields, and priority levels are now configured by item type rather than core workstream location, allowing for a more tailored setup.
Detailed Workstream and Parent Item Completion Stats:

Users can now access detailed stats on child item completion, point estimate completion, time estimate completion, and total time spent for all base items. A new breakdown table by item type offers the same granular stats, providing deeper insights into project progress.
We've renamed "Lane" to “Status” across the platform, clarifying the progress tracking aspect of items.
Notifications now include the location path, offering immediate context about the item's place within the project hierarchy.
Responding to user feedback, we've improved the save function within the item description workspace to prevent data loss.
The settings page navigation has been revamped to be more compact, extendable, and easier to navigate.
Enjoy a fresh look and feel with redesigned Kanban board item cards and resizable lanes, enhancing your planning and task visualization experience.
We've redesigned the Workstreams page with resizable columns and addressed bugs related to jumpiness and double-clicking issues for a smoother interaction.
Fixed issues with calculating the minimum and maximum dates for workstreams on the Gantt charts.
A minor bug with the priority updated automation has been corrected.

We're committed to continuously improving DevStride to fit your project management needs. A big shout-out to our users for their invaluable feedback. If you experience any issues or have suggestions, our support team is ready to jump in and help!
DevStride Release Notes: Sharable Gantt Charts, Item Watchers, and Enhanced Workstream Tracking!
Dive into the latest updates of DevStride! We've been busy refining features to further empower you in managing your projects seamlessly. Here's a look at what's new:

Simplifying collaboration is key, and with that in mind, we've introduced the ability to share links to specific Gantt charts. Now, when you want to direct someone to a particular Gantt chart, just share the unique link. No more navigating and searching – get straight to the chart you need!

Staying informed on project changes has never been easier. Users can now "watch" specific work items, allowing them to receive notifications on selected item changes and events. This feature ensures you're always in the loop, especially for critical tasks or items you're deeply invested in.

We understand that project progress isn't always about the quantity of items done. Now, users have the flexibility to manually set a "percent completed" for workstreams. This means you can define progress based on your judgment, rather than strictly on the number of items, time estimates, or points completed.

We're dedicated to enhancing your project management experience. A huge thanks to our user community for the ongoing feedback, which helps drive our feature development. If you have any queries or suggestions, our support team is always eager to help!
Enhanced Reporting, Improved UI, and More!
We're pleased to announce our latest improvements and features in DevStride, tailored to enhance your productivity and user experience. Dive into the details below!

Gain deeper insights into team performance with the new Individual Time Report. Now, you can track the time spent on work items by each team member for a specific date range, promoting accountability and informed decision-making.

Curious about what's represented in the current progress charts? Users can now delve into specifics, viewing each individual item contributing to the progress. This granular view ensures total clarity on project status.

With our new 'Select All' feature, users can effortlessly select and edit all items matching a particular set of filters. Say goodbye to the limitations of only editing loaded items, and embrace the convenience of bulk edits!
To aid users in understanding the broader project landscape while in card view, we now display the parent workstream. This context ensures users are always oriented and aware of item locations.
Faster and More Comprehensive Item Duplication:
Not only have we made the duplication process swifter, but we've also ensured that all item assets and subtasks are included when duplicating.
Preserve all nested item positions seamlessly when duplicating an entire workstream, ensuring consistent organizational structure across your projects.
We've ironed out several bugs in our reporting feature, ensuring all information presented is accurate and reliable.

We're always striving to offer you the best experience. A big thank you to our community for your continuous feedback and support. Should you encounter any issues or have suggestions for future iterations, our support team is always here to assist!
Revolutionizing DevStride: Fresh Navigation, Enhanced Gantt Features, and More!
We’re thrilled to present our latest updates to DevStride, reinforcing our commitment to providing a seamless project management experience. Dive in and discover what’s new!

: We have a brand new navigation! Say goodbye to the old Work and Plan view. Now, it’s all about simplicity! Use the new View Switcher for an intuitive navigation experience. Welcome to flatter, streamlined navigation that prioritizes user efficiency.
Prominent Queued Updates: Easily identify queued updates in Gantt views, ensuring that no crucial information gets missed.
Data Safety Guards: We’ve added safeguards to prevent unintended data loss when navigating away from the Gantt view.
Smarter Date Inferences: DevStride now offers better inferred dates for workstreams, aiding in more accurate planning.
Copy Asset URLs: Easily access and copy the URLs of your assets directly from the platform.
Flexible Linking: We’ve improved our link validation! Now, DevStride can accept links that may appear malformed but are still valid, ensuring no hitches when linking assets.

Churn Refinements: Our Churn terminology has been updated for clarity! ‘Planned/Unplanned’ is now labeled as ‘Added/Removed’. Dive deeper with more granular insights when assessing a single cycle’s churn.

Completion Stats Update: For those using the map, the embedded completion stats have been removed. To view completion stats, simply use the tooltip or opt for right-clicking and selecting “show completion stats.”
We’ve addressed some reported bugs to enhance your DevStride experience. These include fixes related to Gantt renaming, validation hints for cycle and board creation, and more.

Thank you for being an integral part of our community. We continually strive to make DevStride even better, and your feedback plays a pivotal role. If you come across any issues or have recommendations for future enhancements, please reach out to our support team!
After focusing on user feedback over the past month, we've implemented several improvements to better meet your needs. Here's what's new:
Users can now change their registered email addresses, offering more customization options.
We've added the ability to select and move multiple rows at once, making list rearrangement easier.
To simplify the management of interrelated tasks, we've added the capability to edit task dependencies in bulk.
New sorting fields like Start Date, Author, and Point Effort are now available, providing more control over data views.
Users can now restore archived teams, offering more flexibility in team management.
Subtasks will now inherit default values from their parent tasks, reducing manual input requirements.
A new status option for subtasks has been added for more detailed tracking and insights.
We've also fixed several bugs to improve system stability and user experience. Our focus remains on maintaining a reliable workflow for all users.
We're thrilled to share some exciting updates to our platform. We've been working hard to enhance and streamline your DevStride experience. Here's a simpler summary of the improvements:

We've refined the way you plan and estimate your work. Our update now allows you to estimate time for smaller tasks, helping you manage your workload more effectively. Head to the "Subtasks" tab in the workspace sidebar to try it out.
Gantt now highlights any missing dates, offering you the option to automatically fill them in. This enhancement makes schedule management easier and more intuitive.

: We've made significant improvements in how you view and analyze your reports. New features enable you to view transactions for every report. Additionally, we've started rolling out a new "Items" tab for some reports, which will allow you to drill down into your data and view individual items that make up a report. We'll be adding this feature to more reports in the coming weeks.

Major improvements have been made in managing your subscriptions. This includes fixing issues with cancellation, providing nuanced control over subscription settings and making the whole process more flexible and user-friendly.
The new notifications are designed to help you manage due dates better. These notifications will help you stay organized and on top of your tasks and deadlines.
Due Date Approaching - You choose when and how many days before the due date you want to be notified.
Due Date Arrived - You choose the time of day you want to be notified when the due date arrives.
Overdue - You choose when and how many days after the due date you want to be notified if a task is overdue.

The Board Table now has a footer that displays aggregations for the following metrics: the total number of items in board, time estimation, point efforts, and time spent. By having these aggregated metrics in the footer of the Board Table, you can quickly assess the overall status of the board and get valuable insights into the workload, progress, and complexity of the items at hand. This facilitates better project management and decision-making.

The Cycle Table already had the footer with existing metrics, and the recent addition is: the total time spent in the cycle. This new metric has been incorporated to provide insights into the actual time taken to complete items that are part of cycle, giving a more comprehensive view of cycle progress and performance.

We've addressed a range of bugs that were impacting user experience, including issues related to duplication of items, problems with item deletion, and issues with general search results. We've also improved notification handling to ensure you receive the right information at the right time, we also stopped sending notifications about the status of Github checks.

We've made these changes as a direct result of your valuable feedback and our ongoing commitment to improving DevStride. We're excited for you to experience these enhancements! Thank you for being part of the DevStride community!

Email notifications for comments and replies will now include the full text of the comment or reply so you can do more without leaving your inbox! We went ahead and made it pretty to provide you with all the rich formatting you're used to.
Notifications will now also be marked as read when you open the email, so you can keep your DevStride Notification Center tidy.
You can now view release notes for all the past and current releases of the app without leaving DevStride. Just click on the "Release Notes" link in the Help Center to see what's new!
Workflow runs are loaded on demand now which should provide a better experience for navigating through your workflow history.
Changes will now be saved even when you close a tab or refresh the page, and we made some minor usability improvements in the Quick Add Dialog.
We improved how we handle dates for subtasks, including a fix for some date-related issues.

Please note, we've made some behind-the-scenes improvements for better performance and stability. Thank you for your ongoing support and feedback. We're looking forward to hearing what you think about this update!
We're excited to bring you the latest updates to DevStride. This release includes new features, enhancements, and important bug fixes. Please find the detailed release notes below:
You now have the ability to filter views by subtask assignee, in addition to the existing work item assignee filter.
Users can now create different scenarios in their Gantt chart, enabling them to make strategic comparisons and informed decisions.
We're thrilled to announce the introduction of our new email notification system, keeping you up to date on all important updates and communications.
We heard your feedback and have removed the 50 item limitation on bulk edits.
5. Spatial Keyboard Navigation on the Map:
We've enhanced the navigation experience on the map. Now, you can use arrow keys to smoothly navigate through different workstreams.
To provide better context, the workstream path is now displayed underneath each item in the search results.
We have implemented better error handling for roadmap start and due dates.
To provide better insight into task progress, we've added activity logs for subtasks.
The description and comment editors will now be highlighted when they are in focus, making it easier to see where you're working.
The bug reporting system is now working as expected.
We fixed an issue where archived teams were showing up when switching organizations.
A minor issue with time estimates not getting updated on duplicate items has been fixed.
The quick add item dialog will now only open if no other dialogs are open, ensuring smoother operation.
We fixed an issue where the escape key was not closing the workspace in certain instances.
Fixed an issue where the right-click menu was sticking around after item updates.
Fixed some issues with the date picker to ensure seamless scheduling and rescheduling of tasks.
Thank you for your continuous support. Please continue to share your feedback and help us make DevStride even better for you.
We're excited to announce several new features, enhancements, and bug fixes. Here's what's new in our latest update:

Work items have gotten more powerful with the ability to have a list of subtasks. These subtasks can be checked off as completed, allowing for more granular task tracking. Each subtask also supports assigning a start and due date, and an assignee.

We've upgraded our Gantt charts, offering better control button placement and the ability to expand or collapse full levels. Additionally, we've included progress indicators within the Gantt bars for a quick visual update of your projects. Editable fields in the table now offer you more control, and we've fixed various bugs to make your experience smoother.
We've expanded the automation conditions with options for "is set" and "is not set." This addition will offer more flexibility in automating your workflows.
Making changes in bulk is now easier than ever. We've streamlined the process to bulk edit notifications and enhanced the discoverability of the work item link within notifications.
To ensure the most up-to-date data, we're now updating organization data more frequently. This means any changes you make should appear quicker than before.
We've added fixes to the date input and its popup to make selecting dates smoother and more intuitive.
The bulk edit function in the "My Items" view has been fixed for a better user experience.
We've addressed an issue with the "None" option in team time estimation settings.
We fixed an issue where links to workstreams in the Map were not functioning in certain instances.
We've resolved an issue on the plan view where the item workspace was closing on page reload.
We're constantly working to improve DevStride, and we thank you for your support. Keep the feedback coming, and stay tuned for more exciting updates!
Special Release: Gantt Charts for Effective Initiative Planning

We Gantt believe it. Powerful and versatile Gantt Charts are here! Gantt Charts are designed to enhance your organization’s initiative planning process by providing a clear visual representation of project timelines and task relationships.
DevStride's Gantt Charts offer an at-a-glance view of project timelines, making it easier to track progress and understand task dependencies.
Easily view and update tasks within the Gantt Chart, providing a convenient way to manage your projects and monitor your team’s workflow.
Keep track of your project’s progress with real-time updates, helping you proactively address potential bottlenecks.
Tailor your Gantt Chart by customizing views, applying filters, and adjusting zoom levels to suit your needs.
Thank you for your feedback throughout the design and release of this feature, as it further enhances planning and tracking in DevStride. Please keep the feedback coming!
Unveiling DevStride's Newest Release: AI Chat Assistant, Refined Permissions, Dark Mode, and more!

We're excited to announce the latest update for DevStride, your favorite project management application! This release has added new features and enhancements that will significantly improve your team's productivity and collaboration.

We've integrated an advanced AI chat assistant with deep knowledge of DevStride. Users can now ask questions about the platform, and our chat assistant will provide instant answers and guidance. This new feature will enable your team to work more efficiently and resolve queries faster.
Refined Permissions for Workstreams and Teams:

To give system administrators more control over work visibility, we've introduced refined permissions for both Core Workstreams and Teams. Now, you can assign specific teams to each Core Workstream and restrict access to private team's cycles and boards, ensuring only relevant members can view their contents. This enhancement strengthens project security and ensures your teams focus on their assigned tasks.

We're excited to introduce Dark Mode for DevStride, providing a more comfortable and eye-friendly experience during those late-night work sessions. You can easily switch between light and dark themes through the settings menu, customizing the look of your workspace to match your preference.

We know how important it is to work quickly and efficiently, so we've improved the keyboard navigation within the workspace drawer. Users can now update item properties without leaving their keyboards, streamlining the process and saving valuable time.

We've addressed issues related to using the tab key in the text editor. With these fixes, users can now navigate and edit text more easily, leading to a more enjoyable and efficient editing experience.

As always, we'd like to thank our users for their valuable feedback and suggestions, which have helped us make DevStride even better. If you encounter any issues or have suggestions for future updates, please don't hesitate to reach out to our support team.
Introducing Our Latest Update: Enhanced Workstreams, New Reports, and More

We are excited to announce a new update that will bring major improvements to your experience with our platform. With this update, we've focused on enhancing Workstreams and Work Items, adding new insightful reports, and fixing some pesky bugs. Let's dive in!
Start Dates for Workstreams and Work Items
: We've added the ability to set start dates for Workstreams and Work Items, making it easier to plan and manage your work schedule.
: Introducing the "Relationships" popup in the subheader of the workspace, where you can now create dependencies between Workstreams and items to streamline your workflow.
: We've added some insightful new reports to help you track your team's performance more effectively. These include:
: Measure the average time it takes to start, work on, and complete tasks over a given period.
: Calculate the average time it takes for work items to move between any two lanes over a given period.
: Compare the number of items added vs. removed from a list of cycles or the number of items created vs. completed over a given period.
: See how much work was committed vs. completed for a list of selected cycles.
: We've moved the comments section under the description in the Workspace to make discussions and context tracking more accessible.
: You can now delete Cycles and Boards, allowing you to keep your workspace clean and organized.
: To improve navigation, we've ensured that scrollbars are always visible in selection fields if there are more items than the height of the popup.
: Tags will now be included when an item is duplicated, ensuring all necessary information is carried over.
: We've fixed the comment count issue, ensuring accurate numbers are displayed when comments and replies are created and deleted.
We hope these improvements will help you work more efficiently and effectively on our platform. As always, we appreciate your feedback and look forward to continuing to enhance your experience.
We are excited to announce DevStride's latest release, which includes several new features and enhancements designed to improve the user experience and performance.

One of the major additions is the new "Time Spent" field for work items, which allows users to enter the number of hours and minutes they've spent on each task. This feature also includes a progress bar to show time spent against time estimates, and users can now filter views by the amount of time spent.

Additionally, we have dramatically enhanced report retrieval speed, so users no longer have to wait long to visualize their data. We have also updated the look of the Current Progress charts for a better user experience and added a Trending Progress chart where users can see their progress over time based on completion, estimation, assignment, planned, and lane status.

Furthermore, we've added a Throughput report, which shows daily progress based on item count, time estimate, point estimate, or time spent. The Cumulative Flow, Burn Down, and Burn Up charts are now reportable on any data dimension in the filters, giving users a view of their combined progress across their entire portfolio of work.

Other enhancements include the ability to duplicate Workstreams to any other location on the Map deeply, and admin users can now add tags directly in the workspace's tag selector. We've also made visual enhancements to the Map view, where the last column is now highlighted in blue for better cognitive context.

Finally, the release includes various bug fixes to improve DevStride's overall stability and performance. These fixes were identified through user feedback and our ongoing commitment to delivering a seamless user experience.

These new features and enhancements are aimed at improving the overall user experience and performance of our project management software. We are confident that our users will enjoy the benefits of this new release and look forward to their continued feedback.

There is a new "Time Spent" field for work items. Users can now enter the number of hours/minutes they've spent on each work item. There is also a progress bar to show time spent against time estimates. Users can also filter views by the amount of time spent.
Report retrieval speed has been dramatically enhanced, so users don't have to wait long to visualize their data.
We've updated the look of the Current Progress charts for a better user experience.
We've added a Trending Progress chart where users can see their progress over time based on completion, estimation, assignment, planned, and lane status.
We've added a Throughput report where users can see daily how much was completed based on either item count, time estimate, point estimate, or time spent.

We've made the Cumulative Flow, Burn Down, and Burn Up charts reportable on any data dimension in the filters rather than just based on a Cycle. Now users can see their combined progress across their entire portfolio of work.
Workstreams can now be deeply duplicated to any other location on the Map.
Admin users can now add tags directly in the workspace's tag selector.
Added some visual enhancements to the Map view, where the last column will now be highlighted in blue for better cognitive context.
We've moved the Items view to the Map module instead of Plan.
Adds the ability to choose which completion stats to show on the Workstream Map.
Improves the options on the Work view so that card fields can be hidden from a single dropdown.
We've added pills to each screen where filters, sort, or options are applied so users can see information about what they are viewing without opening the different popups in the toolbar.
Users can now sort by due date on all pages.
Adds the due date to the work item cards on the Work column view.
Fixed an issue where the Core Workstreams would not show on the Map view when filters were applied.
Removed the double warning message when a team is changed.
Fixed some bugs concerning dragging assets into items.
Fixed image copy-paste behavior in the text editor.
Prevents multiple MFA SMS messages when logging in.
Introducing the Future of Workstream Management!
Our new AI-powered engine automatically generates workstreams and work item descriptions, streamlining your workflow and increasing efficiency like never before.
We're excited to share all of the new features and enhancements we've worked on.

First up, we've added Workflow Automation to DevStride. This new feature allows you to automatically have DevStride perform actions like assigning items or changing lane status as items are created, updated, or based on a schedule. This will save you time and effort and help streamline your workflow.

We've also made updates to the work item table, allowing you to simultaneously see an item's properties on the screen by scrolling horizontally. You can customize which columns show and adjust column width to fit your needs. In addition, the Work views now offer a table view and a lane view.

Another new feature is the Current Progress report. This report will give you a clear understanding of how much progress you're making across your portfolio based on item completion status, assignment status, planned status, lane breakdown, time estimate distribution, and effort point distribution.

We've also made a few more minor enhancements to DevStride. Mentioning an item in the editor now brings up recent items when you type #, and we've added a due date filter for Cycle reports. Additionally, we've moved the sort option into its button in the toolbar for better discoverability. Finally, we've increased the font size for reaction emojis for improved visibility.
In addition to these new features and enhancements, we've also made several bug fixes, including fixing an issue where the description created extra activity records while editing.
Workflow Automation - You can now have DevStride automatically perform actions like assigning items or changing lane status as items are created, updated, or based on a schedule.

We've updated the work item table so you can simultaneously see an item's properties on the screen by scrolling horizontally. You can customize which columns show and also adjust column width. The Work views can now offer a table view instead of a lane view.

Current Progress report - a report that will tell you how much progress you are making across your portfolio based on item completion status, assignment status, planned status, lane breakdown, time estimate distribution, and effort point distribution.
When mentioning an item in the editor, typing # will show recent items.
We added a due date filter for Cycle reports.
Moved the sort option into its own button in the toolbar. It is more discoverable now.
Increases the font size for reaction emojis.
Moved the "recents" button into the global search input for a more consistent design.
Added a bulk edit action for due dates.

We've made adding work items quicker by moving the "Add item" button to the toolbar on all applicable pages so that fields like "Team" and "Cycle" are auto-applied. In addition, your last used workstream location and applicable custom fields are now saved in your browser for the "create item prompt" so you don't have to select them when they haven't changed.
The description will not create extra activity records while editing anymore.
The option to "show planned items" on the plan views will now persist between page loads
Fixed jumpy behavior when reordering workstreams on the Map view.
Improved the loading behavior on the map view for a better user experience.
We are excited to announce some new features and enhancements to our platform!

First, we've added support for Kanban workflows, allowing teams to use boards to manage their work instead of just cycles. This will give teams more flexibility in how they organize and track their work.

Additionally, we've added filters for due dates on all relevant pages. This will allow users to easily scope their data based on item timelines, making it easier to stay on top of deadlines and prioritize their work.

We've also made some important bug fixes, including fixing a bug in the cycle reports where updating the team was not loading the correct data, and fixing the activity log range filter. We've also addressed a bug where some pages would say a sort was applied when it wasn't.
We hope these enhancements will make it even easier for teams to manage their work and stay organized. Look out for more new features coming very soon!
Adds support for Kanban workflows enabling teams to work using Boards instead of only Cycles.
We added filters for due dates on all relevant pages so users can scope their data based on item timelines.
Fixed a bug in the Cycle reports where updating the team was not loading the correct data.
When opening the Cycle picker, if there are no current or future Cycles, we scroll to the latest past Cycle.
Fixed the activity log range filter.
Fixes a bug where some pages would say a sort was applied when it wasn't.
We added a toggle in analytics charts so that you can switch between the chart view and and the data table transaction view.
Added a quick add button to the "New" lane on the Work > Board view and also the current tab on the Plan > Cycles view so you can create work items faster.
We've added a "Recents" button the the page header that lists all recently viewed items and workstreams for easy access.
We've also added a "Recents" button to the workstream location picker so you don't have to click through the map tree every time you create an item.
We've added sorting to both the Plan > Cycles and Work > Board views.
Fixes the global search so it finds items and workstreams correctly.
Added a "Due Date" field to work items. Overdue items will now be highlighted in red.
You can now "mention" Workstreams or Work Items using the hashtag (#) key in descriptions or comments.
When changing organizations settings, users will now only get a warning if the setting change will edit item field values.
Added an option in the Cycle reports to include events that happened after the cycle ended.
Fixed a bug where users could delete the default custom field collection in settings.
Fixed activity log items for time estimation.
You can now filter the Map view. Filters will work on Workstreams as well as items, so you can narrow down your search without needing to navigate into each non applicable workstream.
Added the ability to rank items in the Map view's columns. Use the drag handle to move items up or down within their parent column.
The Map view can also now be sorted. We added 2 buttons to the options in the toolbar - one for sorting Workstreams and another for sorting Items.
You can now press CMD/CTRL+K to add a link or make text a link.
We added a merged PR indicator to the work board cards for users that use the Github integration.
Adds table support to descriptions and comments.
Adds the ability to navigate to a specific cycle using the URL on the plan view.
Enhanced the view when the toolbar is hidden. You'll now see things like a team and cycle select on the Plan > Cycles page next to the collapsed toolbar button.
You can now enter your Organization's industry, size, and work methodology so DevStride can serve you and similar Organizations better.
Fixes an issue where the item workspace's would have the sidebar but off.
Fixes an issue where sometimes the cycle would not automatically get selected when viewing cycle reports in Analyze.
On the Plan > Cycles view, if you resize the browser window the active tab will stay active.
Fixes an issue where duplicating an item on the map view would not include it's description.
When you click on the breadcrumbs to navigate to the parent of an item from the drawer now you can
and it will open a new tab.
Editor typography was improved and we are using a similar style as Github
Show transactions list in the analytics tab
Allow exporting sprint transactions from the analytics tab
Fix a bug where the comment reply was pushing the sidebar to the right
Fix a bug where tags are being wiped because of stale data on other users browsers
Fix a bug where when you approve/decline a join request the loading was hanging
